Stem: Woody rootstock, hairy stems branching out.
Leaves: Alternate along stems, up to 9 cm long, dull green, soft and hairy, taper at both ends.
Flowers: Small, tubular, pink to blue with yellow centre, arranged on a coiled spike.
Habitat: Pastures, crops, roadsides, disturbed areas, riverbanks.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinguished from other heliotropes by tapered leaves and glandular hairs.
